title: Fun in Charlotte: Corn maze, IMAX space flick, student night at the opera
text:
Pumpkin Picking and Corn Maze 
Hall Family Farm, 10713 Providence Road West 
Wednesday, 9 a.m. - 6 p.m.: A five-acre corn maze, pumpkin picking and hayrides are part of the fall festivities. Corn Maze $8 ages 9 and up, $6 ages 3-8; hayrides $3 ages 3 and up; pumpkins $0.59/pound. www.hallfamilyfarm.com 
Journey to Space IMAX 
Discovery Place, 301 N. Tryon St. 
Wednesday, 10 a.m., noon, 2 p.m.: Narrated by Patrick Stewart, the film gives a behind-the-scenes look at the effort to send an astronaut to Mars in the next 20 years. Tickets $5 member, $10 non-member adults (ages 14-59), $5/$9 children ages 2-13 and seniors 60+. www.discoveryplace.org 
Fidelio Student Night at the Opera 
Belk Theater, 130 N. Tryon St. 
Thursday, 7 p.m.: The final dress rehearsal gives students K-12 and their chaperones a chance to see Beethoven’s only opera. Tickets $5.82 - $10.74. blumenthalarts.org. 
SlamCharlotte Poetry Slam 
McGlohon Theaer, 345 N. College St. 
Friday, 8 p.m.: The monthly poetry slam hosted by SlamCharlotte, the two-time national championship team of spoken word poetry (2007 and 2008). Tickets $10, blumenthalarts.org. 
Lost Hollow Music Fest 
Daniel Stowe Botanical Gardens, 6500 S. New Hope Road, Belmont 
Saturday, 10 a.m. - 4 p.m.: Three bands play Saturday, and another three Sunday in the Garden’s first music festival. Also features food trucks, craft beer and cornhole tournament. Admission $12.95 adults, $6.95 children (ages 2-12) for one-day pass. See www.dsbg.org for more information. Related content
